Sub-Question.Question: What is the definition of a mechanical wave?
Sub-Question.Answer: A mechanical wave is a disturbance that propagates through a material medium (solid, liquid, or gas) due to the oscillation of particles within the medium, transferring energy from one location to another without transporting matter.

Sub-Question.Question: Explain the concept of a mechanical wave in your own words.
Sub-Question.Answer: A mechanical wave occurs when particles in a medium vibrate and pass on their energy to neighboring particles. This creates a ripple effect where the disturbance moves through the medium, like ripples spreading out when you throw a stone into water.
